content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully established on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to supply a Lab for receiving Automation Science Packs at (0.5, 2.5), but all placement and crafting attempts failed due to inventory shortages and missing sub‐ingredients. In addition, two furnace entities were identified and used for resource processing:
 
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
Used for converting iron ore into iron plates.
 
### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (–27.0, –60.0)
Used for converting copper ore into copper plates.
 
(Note: These furnace structures appear to be pre‐existing facilities that the agent interacted with rather than newly constructed structures.)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Misuse  
 – When invoking get_entities, do not supply unsupported keywords (e.g. avoid using “radius”) or excess positional arguments.  
 – Review the function’s signature and pass parameters in the expected format to prevent TypeErrors and unexpected argument errors.

• Lab Placement and Crafting Issues  
 – Confirm that a Lab unit is present in the inventory before attempting placement at (0.5, 2.5).  
 – Verify that all required sub‐ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are available or can be produced with available facilities prior to crafting a Lab.  
 – When processing the returned entities (e.g. filtering labs), check for a None value and use a fallback (like an empty list) to avoid “NoneType object is not iterable” errors.

• Resource Dependency Verification  
 – Monitor inventory levels and resource chains to ensure that essential base items (like iron plates and copper plates) are available to support subsequent crafting requirements.
